message.raw: After a 1.4 re-harness. Could not get it out of that situation with other re-harness attempts.
message.html: After a 1.4 re-harness. Could not get it out of that situation with other re-harness attempts.

message.raw:
A restart after a collapse, for unknown reason, of 1.4 resulted in this foot configuration. The harness drop cannot complete because both feet are not on the ground. Repeated restarts of 1.4 failed to dislodge the feet. 

To work properly the re-harness has to repeat the startup harness process which shakes the robot out into a position with all limbs dangling loosely. 

I said it earlier that the re-harness on a skip needed to be under the control of the contestant. The re-harness makes a big change in the flow of actions. Others have said it and I've experienced also, the need to rework code to respond to this last minute decision. It's now leading to further challenges both for the competition software team and the competitors.
message.html:
A restart after a collapse, for unknown reason, of 1.4 resulted in this foot configuration. The harness drop cannot complete because both feet are not on the ground. Repeated restarts of 1.4 failed to dislodge the feet.

To work properly the re-harness has to repeat the startup harness process which shakes the robot out into a position with all limbs dangling loosely.

I said it earlier that the re-harness on a skip needed to be under the control of the contestant. The re-harness makes a big change in the flow of actions. Others have said it and I've experienced also, the need to rework code to respond to this last minute decision. It's now leading to further challenges both for the competition software team and the competitors.

message.raw:
Changed this to a blocker. I continually see the robot caught in 'standing' status after a skip. We can't run the competition with this situation. 

The robot has to come down in a decent position not totally discombobulated or hung up on other entities in the landscape. 

Even when it works there is an inordinate amount of blood, sweat and tears spent in creating code to get the robot back into a reasonable stance, especially getting the feet into a decent orientation. 

Go back to the original skip process and only re-harness when fallen.
message.html:
Changed this to a blocker. I continually see the robot caught in 'standing' status after a skip. We can't run the competition with this situation.

The robot has to come down in a decent position not totally discombobulated or hung up on other entities in the landscape.

Even when it works there is an inordinate amount of blood, sweat and tears spent in creating code to get the robot back into a reasonable stance, especially getting the feet into a decent orientation.

Go back to the original skip process and only re-harness when fallen.
